name: Luteolin
description: Flavonoid found in celery, peppers, and chamomile with potent anti-neuroinflammatory and mast cell stabilizing properties. Crosses the blood-brain barrier and inhibits microglial activation, making it particularly relevant for brain aging and neuroinflammation.

dosage.notes: Liposomal form for better absorption. Found in celery seed, chamomile, peppers. Often combined with rutin for synergy.

keyFindings: Potent inhibitor of microglial activation and neuroinflammation
Improved cognitive function in brain fog and post-viral syndromes
Crosses blood-brain barrier — one of few flavonoids that does effectively
interactions: CYP3A4 and CYP1A2 substrates (may inhibit metabolism)
